required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of ctDNA in the Evaluation of Curative Effect and Prognosis of SCLC Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Circulating Tumor (ctDNA) in the Evaluation of Curative Effect and Prognosis of Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC) Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the application value of circulating tumor DNA(ctDNA) with efficacy evaluation and prognostic assessment in patients with unresectable SCLC, who were receiving radiotherapy and chemotherapy treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. According to each point in time of ctDNA, to analyze the dynamic changes of tumor burden and clonal subtypes which to evaluate the application value of ctDNA in curative efficacy evaluation.
2. Compare the two time points before and after radiotherapy and chemotherapy treatment of the cell free DNA (cfDNA) concentration and tumor burden, analysis the correlation between the changes and prognosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: before treatment ctDNA mutation analysis and clonal analysis (each cycle is 3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: ctDNA mutation will be detected, PyClone based clonal analysis will be performed to analyze the clonal dominance

primary_outcome.measure: the evolution of ctDNA mutation profile during treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: After the first cycle of first line treatment upon physicians' request, ctDNA mutation analysis and clonal analysis (each cycle is 3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: ctDNA mutation will be detected, PyClone based clonal analysis will be performed to analyze the clonal dominance

primary_outcome.measure: the evolution of ctDNA mutation profile during treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: After finished the first line treatment, ctDNA mutation analysis and clonal analysis (each cycle is 3 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: ctDNA mutation will be detected, PyClone based clonal analysis will be performed to analyze the clonal dominance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first line treatment to the time of disease progression (through study completion, an average of 5 months)

clinical_study.condition: Small Cell Lung Cancer Extensive Stage

intervention.description: observe the association of ctDNA with efficacy of treatment

study_pop.textblock: treatment extensive stage small cell lung cancer patients

reference.citation: Mohan S, Foy V, Ayub M, Leong HS, Schofield P, Sahoo S, Descamps T, Kilerci B, Smith NK, Carter M, Priest L, Zhou C, Carr TH, Miller C, Faivre-Finn C, Blackhall F, Rothwell DG, Dive C, Brady G. Profiling of Circulating Free DNA Using Targeted and Genome-wide Sequencing in Patients with SCLC. J Thorac Oncol. 2020 Feb;15(2):216-230. doi: 10.1016/j.jtho.2019.10.007. Epub 2019 Oct 16.

Nong J, Gong Y, Guan Y, Yi X, Yi Y, Chang L, Yang L, Lv J, Guo Z, Jia H, Chu Y, Liu T, Chen M, Byers L, Roarty E, Lam VK, Papadimitrakopoulou VA, Wistuba I, Heymach JV, Glisson B, Liao Z, Lee JJ, Futreal PA, Zhang S, Xia X, Zhang J, Wang J. Circulating tumor DNA analysis depicts subclonal architecture and genomic evolution of small cell lung cancer. Nat Commun. 2018 Aug 6;9(1):3114. doi: 10.1038/s41467-018-05327-w. Erratum in: Nat Commun. 2019 Jan 29;10(1):552.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD will be shared when the clinical trail is completed.
